commissioners on the pro-merger side of a 4-1 vote. By any measure, it was the wrong vote, as was the Justice Department's dismissal of antitrust concerns raised by the deal. Michael Copps said, The Comcast-NBCU joint venture opens the door to the cable-ization of the open Internet. The potential for walled gardens, tollbooths, content prioritization, access fees... and a stake in the heart of independent content production is now very real. Parallel objections came from the savviest observers of media issues on Capitol Hill. ''Big media just got a lot bigger,'' declared Sen. Bernie Sanders Maurice Hinchey ( D., N.Y.).
